edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.common
Class LSPSortByField

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.common.LSPObject
        |
        +--edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.common.LSPSortByField
public class LSPSortByField
extends LSPObject

A representation of the "sort-by-field" header of STARTS 1.0 This header is found inside an LSPQuery, and tells the BackEndLSP what fields should be used for sorting the results. A SortByField really only consists of the LSPField to sort on - or, alternatively, the document score - and whether this sorting be in ascending or descending order. If LSPSortByField is for the document score, the order can only be descending. A BackEndLSP receiving multiple LSPSortByFields should first sort on the first field, then the second, etc.

          Constant for indicating that the sort is ascending
